topic: How to observe web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to observe web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Observing Web Backends Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to use FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, to observe and monitor your web backends.
key_points: FastAPI is a highly-performant, easy-to-use web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
It simplifies the process of handling HTTP requests and responses, making it easier to build APIs quickly and efficiently.
FastAPI provides built-in features like automatic API documentation, type hints, and error handling out of the box.
This guide will demonstrate how to use FastAPI for observing web backends by creating a simple application that logs HTTP requests.
In addition, we'll show you how to set up logging, middleware, and dependencies to make your FastAPI application more robust.

code_examples.code:
import logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
from fastapi.middleware.log_request import LogRequestMiddleware

caveats: Ensure you have the necessary Python and FastAPI dependencies installed before running your code.
This guide provides a basic introduction to observing web backends using FastAPI. For more complex scenarios, refer to the official FastAPI documentation.
